metadata.Title: CVE-2017-11664 on Ubuntu 23.04 (lunar) - medium.
metadata.Description:
The _WM_SetupMidiEvent function in internal_midi.c:2122 in WildMIDI 0.4.2 can cause a denial of service (invalid memory read and application crash) via a crafted mid file. It was discovered that WildMIDI incorrectly handled certain MID files. A remote attacker could possibly use this issue to cause a denial of service.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-11664` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libwildmidi-config - 0.4.2-1
libwildmidi2 - 0.4.2-1
wildmidi - 0.4.2-1
No subscription required

notes.Note: ebarretto> Looking at the patches and the version on Trusty, it seems like some of the patches are not appliable and others are tricky to backport. So considering really low for Trusty.

criterions.comment: wildmidi package in lunar, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '0.4.2-1').
